3.12.1.title: Overview
3.12.1.content:
BOP testing ensures equipment will function when needed:

**Types of Tests:**
- Pressure tests (verify seal integrity)
- Function tests (verify operation)
- Response time tests (verify speed)

**Regulatory Basis:**
- API RP 53 provides industry guidance
- Local regulations specify requirements
- Company standards may exceed regulatory minimum

**Key Principle:**
Testing must be rigorous enough to verify function but not so frequent as to cause unnecessary wear.

3.12.2.title: Initial Testing
3.12.2.content:
**When Required:**
- New BOP installation
- After stack pulled and reinstalled
- Before starting drilling operations

**Surface BOP:**
- Full working pressure test
- Test all rams and annular
- Test choke and kill lines
- Test accumulator capacity
- Function test all controls

**Subsea BOP:**
- Onshore test before deployment
- Subsea test after landing on wellhead
- All functions verified
- Acoustic backup tested

3.12.3.title: Periodic Testing - Surface
3.12.3.content:
**Pressure Tests:**

**Low Pressure Test:**
- 200-300 psi
- Verifies seal integrity
- Frequency: Weekly (or per regulation)
- Tests all rams and annular

**High Pressure Test:**
- Full rated working pressure (or percentage)
- Frequency: Every 21 days typical (or per regulation)
- May be reduced frequency in some jurisdictions

**Function Tests:**
- Open and close all preventers
- Verify full travel
- Observe for anomalies
- Frequency: Weekly typical

3.12.4.title: Periodic Testing - Subsea
3.12.4.content:
**Pressure Tests:**
- Low pressure: Weekly
- High pressure: Every 14-21 days (varies by regulation)
- Tested from surface control

**Function Tests:**
- All functions operated
- Including shear rams (without shearing)
- Emergency disconnect (without actual disconnect)
- Control pod switching

**Additional:**
- Acoustic system tested
- ROV intervention panel verified
- Response times documented

3.12.5.title: Testing After Events
3.12.5.content:
**BOP Must Be Tested After:**
- Any well control event (kick)
- Suspected ram damage
- Equipment malfunction
- Repairs or maintenance
- Stack reconfiguration

**Post-Kick:**
- Function test all components used
- Pressure test if rams were closed on pressure
- Verify no damage from operation

3.12.6.title: Test Procedures
3.12.6.content:
**Pressure Test Procedure:**
1. Close preventer to be tested
2. Isolate test area (close valves)
3. Apply test pressure from below
4. Hold for required time (typically 5 minutes)
5. Observe pressure - should not drop
6. Record result
7. Bleed pressure and open preventer
8. Verify preventer opens fully

**Function Test Procedure:**
1. Operate preventer close function
2. Verify closure (indicator or observation)
3. Note closing time
4. Operate open function
5. Verify full open
6. Note opening time
7. Record results

**Accumulator Test:**
1. Record accumulator pressure
2. Disable pumps
3. Operate all BOPs (close and open one ram)
4. Record final pressure
5. Verify meets minimum requirements
6. Re-enable pumps

3.12.7.title: Documentation
3.12.7.content:
**Record:**
- Date and time
- Test type (pressure/function)
- Equipment tested
- Test pressure and duration
- Results (pass/fail)
- Any observations or issues
- Tester name/signature

**Retention:**
- Per regulatory requirements
- Typically life of well plus years
- Available for audit

**Format:**
- Standard forms
- Electronic records acceptable
- Chart recorder data where used
